title: Multiple Secure Boot WIM Files on UEFI Bootable USB

forumNotes.author: Chaos Storm
forumNotes.content:
I've looked around on the forums and while I've found plenty of tutorials on making Multi Boot USB that are UEFI ready, what I am after is slightly different.

I have a NTFS 64GB flash drive I currently use to boot Legacy systems with utilities such as WinRE, Acronis, Paragon, etc. These I created using EasyBCD which was easy enough.

Now, I have another 64GB flash drive that I have formatted as FAT32 and currently it boots into Acronis using UEFI Secure Boot.

I want to add more to the boot entries so my other WIM files which are UEFI ready, can be booted. However, when I try and add them using EasyBCD it always reverts to adding them as MBR/Legacy and does not use winload.efi in the boot entry but instead uses winload.exe which forces the image to boot into Legacy Mode. With UEFI Secure Boot on, this causes the machine to just sit at a black screen.

Is there a command or way to add more entries but have them use winload.efi? I've searched high and low (to the best of my knowledge) but I saw allot of Multi Boot/UEFI (No mention of Secure Boot which is a requirement)

Any help is most appreciated.

forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content: Maybe add entries to the wim files in the relevant bcd store, using bcdedit utility, or bootice?

forumNotes.author: wimb
forumNotes.content:
> Now, I have another 64GB flash drive that I have formatted as FAT32 and currently it boots into Acronis using UEFI Secure Boot.
>
> I want to add more to the boot entries so my other WIM files which are UEFI ready, can be booted.

What you want is in fact to add more entries in UEFI BootManager menu for booting various sources\\boot_xxx.wim into RAMDISK where xxx is pe4 or acr or par

I think you need then to modify the EFI\\Microsoft\\Boot\\BCD store by using bcdedit or more easy by using BOOTICE

[http://bbs.ipauly.co...pic.php?f=2\&t=2](http://bbs.ipauly.com/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=2 "External link")

BOOTICE is also part of WinNTSetup v3 Beta3 and can be launched with icon in upper right corner in WinNTSetup3 - [http://www.msfn.org/...winntsetup-v23/](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/149612-winntsetup-v23/ "External link")

WinNTSetup v3 will download also the right bcdedit tool given in WinNTSetup3\\Tools\\x86

BOOTICE allows you to view the specific BCD store and probably to Add more entries for booting into RAMDISK

forumNotes.author: boyans
forumNotes.content:
You can always edit winload.exe to winload.efi using [Visual BCD Editor](http://www.boyans.net "External link").

I hope next version will come soon and insert proper path automatically depending on BIOS/UEFI boot.
